User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111104165243

Steps to reproduce:

In "Applications" I set up "Use okular" for "Portable Document Format (application/pdf)". This setting normally works as expected by downloading the file and opening it with okular.


Actual results:

After a while of intended operation the file instead is saved to ~/Downloads, not opened with okular. The "Action" entry now points to "Save file". I do not know what caused this change to be made, but I am sure I did not edit the "Action" entry manually. Resetting to "Use okular" helps, but not for more than a few weeks.


Expected results:

The files should be opened with okular and the setting should remain at "Use okular".

comments.text:
I think I found the problem.

Sometimes I get offered a PDF file which triggers the open/save dialog to open (in the example I just found it was a result of clicking a button and sending a form inside a HTTPs web banking application). The dialog starts with "You have chosen to open".

This dialog also has a check box "Do this automatically for files like this from now on.", which is checked. Changing the option from "Open with" to "Save File" but leaving the check box checked causes the "bug" I mentioned here. I strongly feel this is what I did in the past. Since the button on web site that triggered this behaviour is only clicked once a month by me, this might be the single cause for this problem.

Now two things need to be considered in my opinion:
1) Why is my file not being opened directly without showing the dialog, although I set that up?
2) Maybe it is a good idea to uncheck the check box automatically when the action is moved away from the default, so that the user explicitly has to confirm a new default?

Thanks,
Carsten

> Is there a public web page out there that triggers this for you?

There is a (German) test account for that bank:
1) https://bankingportal.sparkasse-aachen.de/portal/portal/StartenIPSTANDARD?p=p.chiptanverfahren
2) Login with "chipDEMO" and "12345"
3) Click "Banking" (left panel)
4) Click "Kontoauszug" (left panel)
5) Click button "Weiter"
6) Click button "Speichern"
7) The aforementioned form should pop up (try changing to "Save file" and observe the "Do this..." checkbox! See below.)

> When Always Ask is selected for me, the dialog pops up as normal and the
> option is not checked by default. The only issue spotted thus far was that
> the Always Ask dialog didn't trigger if I previously used Acrobat in Nightly.

I was talking about the case where "Use okular" is set up for every option I see for PDF files. Then two problems are observable:
1) The dialog pops up and asks me (with default set to okular, but okular is not directly opened as intended)
2) When I change to "Save file", the "Do this automatically..." checkbox is still left checked and the default is changed to "Save file" (without asking), which is not what I want. Here I suggest to uncheck the "Do this automatically..." option if it differs from the already configured setting (here: "Use okular").
